# Challenge Name

Leaked d

# Author

janky

# Description

Someone leaked my d, surely generating a new key pair is safe enough.
````

  
e1=65537
  


e2=6767671


````
# Solution

Had to make a python script to get the flag 

````
from math import gcd
from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes, inverse

#Given values 
n = 
e1 = 65537
d1 = 
e2 = 6767671
c  = 
Recover p and q using leaked d1 
k = e1 * d1 - 1
for i in range(2, 1 << 20):
    if k % i == 0:
        phi_candidate = k // i
        p = gcd(pow(2, phi_candidate, n) - 1, n)
        if 1 < p < n:
            q = n // p
            if p * q == n:
                print("[+] Factors found")
                break
Compute phi(n) 
phi = (p - 1) * (q - 1)
Compute new private key for e2 
d2 = inverse(e2, phi)
Decrypt ciphertext 
m = pow(c, d2, n)
Output 
print("[+] Decrypted integer:", m)
print("[+] Decrypted message:", long_to_bytes(m))
````

# Flag

uoftctf{1_5h0u1dv3_ju57_ch4ng3d_th3_wh013_th1ng_1n5734d}
